Package com.example.enigma.Model.Client

Class User

java.lang.Object
com.example.enigma.Model.Client.User
public class User extends Object
The User class represents a user in the Enigma application. It provides access to user information, such as ID, name, secret code, password, and user keys. The User class follows the singleton design pattern.
Author:
Mojtaba Alizade

  • Method Details

    • getInstance

      public static User getInstance()
      Returns the instance of the User class.
      Returns:
      The User instance.

    • init

      public void init(String[] filePaths)
      Initialize the paths to the CSV files
      Parameters:
      filePaths - The paths to the CSV files

    • currentUser

      public void currentUser(String userName)
      Sets the current user based on the provided username. Retrieves the user information from the user CSV file.
      Parameters:
      userName - The username of the current user.

    • keys

      public void keys()
      Retrieves the user keys from the keys CSV file. Populates the userKeys map with the key-value pairs.

    • getUserId

      public int getUserId()
      Returns the ID of the current user.
      Returns:
      The user ID.

    • getName

      public String getName()
      Returns the name of the current user.
      Returns:
      The user name.

    • getSecretCode

      public String getSecretCode()
      Returns the secret code of the current user.
      Returns:
      The user secret code.

    • getPassword

      public String getPassword()
      Returns the password of the current user.
      Returns:
      The user password.

    • getUserKeys

      public Map<String,String> getUserKeys()
      Returns the user keys as a map.
      Returns:
      The user keys map.

    • newMap

      public void newMap()
      Clears the userKeys map.

    • isRemembered

      public boolean isRemembered()
      Checks if the current user's secret code is remembered based on remember CSV file.
      Returns:
      true if the user is remembered, false otherwise.
